findings.title: Lack of Slippage Control in _zapNativeToSecondaryWant()
findings.description: In the `Dyson` protocol, there is no slippage control for token transformation in the `_zapNativeToSecondaryWant()` function of the `MaximizerBalancer` contract.

findings.title: Accommodation of Non-ERC20-Compliant Tokens
findings.description: The `transfer` function does not follow the ERC20 standard, allowing transactions to proceed successfully without being reverted even if the check fails, which may cause issues if not handled properly.

findings.title: Possible Costly Vault Token from Improper Initialization
findings.description: The `deposit()` function in `DysonMaximizerBalancerVault` contract may cause the vault token to become extremely expensive due to improper initialization, leading to hurdles or loss for later depositors.

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: In the Dyson protocol, there is a privileged accounts, e.g., owner, that plays a critical role in governing and regulating the system-wide operations.
